issues.description: The return type of Stock.take in the template (boolean) conflicts with the problem specification UML and the solution implementation, which require Stock.take to return an int. This mismatch will cause compilation errors when students implement checkOrderReady logic that checks for -1 returned from take().
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template’s Stock.take method signature to return an int (not boolean), matching the UML specification and the solution. It should return -1 on failure and the remaining quantity on success.
